column4: hey all, im new to ubuntu and i was wondering how do i access my windows drive? i've got two drives right now, windows isn't loading (on the first drive) so i installed ubuntu on the second drive and now i'm trying to get crap off of it.
ubuntu should be able to mount the windows partitions, read only, should work per default.
yes, moving is a WRITE opperation, which is not supported on NTFS(windows) partitions
you can assign a key to open your HOME. I assigned the left "windows" key for it.
